content.question: Students in lab are attempting to determine the spring constant of a spring. They attach objects of varying masses <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to the end of the spring and measure the period of oscillation, <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for each mass object. The data for <math alttext="T squared" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math> as a function of <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown in the graph the square of the period as a function of the mass, as shown. What is the approximate spring constant of the spring? Which of the following has the best-fit line that can be used to find the approximate value for the spring constant shown?

choices.label: The figure presents a scatterplot and a line of best fit drawn in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled m, in kilograms” and the numbers 0 through 1.0, in increments of 0.5, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled T squared, in seconds squared and the numbers 0 through 8, are indicated. A statement reads k equals 0.25 Newton per meter. There are 7 data points on the graph, which are as follows. Note all values are approximate. Point 1: 0.06 kilogram comma 0.8 seconds squared. Point 2: 0.2 kilogram comma 2.2 seconds squared. Point 3: 0.35 kilogram comma 2.8 seconds squared. Point 4: 0.4 kilogram comma 4.5 seconds squared. Point 5: 0.5 kilogram comma 5.4 seconds squared. Point 6: 0.65 kilogram comma 5.8 seconds squared. Point 7: 0.78 kilogram comma 7 seconds squared. A straight line moving upward and to the right is drawn from a point with coordinates 0.01 kilogram comma 0.2 seconds squared to a point at 0.78 kilogram comma 7.3 seconds squared. A straight line moving upward and to the right is drawn from a point with coordinates 0 kilograms comma 0.2 seconds squared to a point at 0.75 kilogram comma 7.2 seconds.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
